action.action-desc: Mr. Joyce of Ohio (for himself and Mr. Rulli) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Workforce

form.official-title: To prohibit elementary and secondary schools from accepting funds from or entering into contracts with the Government of the People’s Republic of China and the Chinese Communist Party, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Combating the Lies of Authoritarians in School Systems Act or the CLASS Act.

section.header: Prohibition on funding from and contracts with the Government of the People’s Republic of China and the Chinese Communist Party
section.text: As a condition on receipt of Federal financial assistance under any applicable program by a public elementary school or public secondary school, the school may not accept funds from or enter into a contract with—

paragraph.text: the Government of the People’s Republic of China;
any individual or entity acting directly or indirectly on behalf of such Government or Party.

section.header: Disclosure of foreign funding and contracts
section.text: As a condition on receipt of Federal financial assistance under any applicable program by a public elementary school or public secondary school, the school shall, not later than 30 days after receiving funds or entering into a contract with a foreign source, submit to the Secretary of Education a written disclosure that identifies—

paragraph.text: the name and country of origin of the foreign source;
in a case in which a school receives funds from a foreign source—

subparagraph.text: the amount of funds received from that source; and
any terms or conditions applicable to the receipt of such funds; and

paragraph.text: in a case in which a school enters into a contract with a foreign source, the terms and conditions of such contract.
The term applicable program has the meaning given that term in section 400 of the General Education Provisions Act (20 U.S.C. 1221).
The terms elementary school and secondary school have the meanings given those terms in section 8101 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7801).
The term Federal financial assistance has the meaning given that term in section 7501(a)(5) of title 31, United States Code.
The term foreign source has the meaning given that term in section 117(h) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1011f(h)).
